Changing the Version Label Type (Fixed vs. Floating)

Once you have assigned a version label to a revision, project, or project database, you can change its type from fixed to floating or from floating to fixed .

To change a version label type:

  1. Select the versioned file(s), project, folder, or project database that contains the version label you want to change.

  2. Select Actions | Version Label | Assign. The Assign Version Label dialog box appears.

  3. In the Assign Version Label field, enter the version label that you want to change.

  4. In the To revision field, do one of the following:

    • If you are changing a fixed label to a floating label, leave [Default Revision] in this field or leave the field blank.
    • If you are changing a floating label to a fixed label, enter the revision number, version label, or promotion group identifying the specific revision or click the Browse button to select the revision.


  5. Select the Float label with tip check box if you are changing a fixed label to a floating label. If you are changing a floating label to a fixed label, do not select this check box.

  6. From the If version label exists drop-down list, select Reassign.

  7. If you are changing a version label assigned to a project or project database, select the Include files in subprojects check box to change the version label in all of the versioned files contained in the project or project database.

  8. Click OK.
